intro: Guilielma granatensis, commonly known as the Granada guilielma, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
